abstract.para: Nutrients run on the AA and by manual chemistry for the Kuparuk River during the summer of 1994.

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications
A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Kuparuk River, North Slope of Alaska

description.para:
For Archival Use:
DATE RECEIVED:April 5, 1995 DATA FILE ENTERED BY: Chris Harvey DATA FILE VALIDATION: NAME: Chris Harvey DATE: April 5, 1995

para.literalLayout: Biweekly water samples collected at designated sites along the Kuparuk river were analyzed for soluble reactive phosphate, ammonium, and nitrate/nitrite on the Technicon Autoanalyzer II. Technicon methods were used. Each run was calibrated with 4 standards and a blank for every sample tray. For much of the season, ammonium samples were also run by manual chemistry using an adaptation from Standard Methods, 1985.

Notes: This year, the Kuparuk was not sampled as intensively as in previous summers. Rather than taking entire transects of the study reach, weekly samples were primarily taken at the station at +0.564 km, located just upstream of the phosphorus dripper. Two full transects were taken, the first on July 15 and the second on August 5.
Reference Citations: R.G. Wetzel & G.E. Likens. 1979. Limnological Methods. Saunders. Philadelphia. APHA. 1985. Standard Methods. Boyd. Albany.
